name: Pope Paschal II
summary: Paschal II, born Ranierius, was Pope from 1099 to 1118. He continued the Gregorian Reform movement and the Investiture Controversy. He had conflicts with Holy Roman Emperor Henry V over investiture, leading to his imprisonment. He eventually reached a compromise with the emperor. He supported the First Crusade and worked to resolve the investiture question. His pontificate was marked by ongoing struggles between papal and imperial authority.
